attributes.comment:
I was unclear about which measures are taking place to increase productivity per
employee. Very much like in the private sector, where employees are evaluated
and in most cases compensated according to his/her performance, it would seem to
me that the government sector should have a similar policy.

I could not readily find evidence of work quality and work productivity anywhere
in the current literature. I was unsure where specifically the extra revenue
generated will be applied to. Are there alternative venues to improve processing
time? Is there a quota system per employee? Is there a training system in place
to improve his/her time management or case study/processing performance? Are
there measures to improve employee satisfaction in the workplace, which direclty
correlates with better performance? What about the current leadership within the
department? Are the leaders of the department the most qualified to perform the
job? If so, what specifically is he/she missing to improve his/her goals, beyond
extra revenues?
